required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: An Initial Study of the Implementation of Digital Therapeutics for Substance Use Disorders in Primary Care
clinical_study.official_title: Digital Therapeutics for Opioids and Other Substance Use Disorders in Primary Care Pilot (DIGITS Trial Pilot)

brief_summary.textblock: The DIGITS Trial addresses a critical knowledge gap: How to best implement digital treatments for opioids and other substance use disorders in primary care. In this pilot study, the FDA-authorized reSET and reSET-O digital therapeutics will be implemented in 2 primary care clinics as part of quality improvement. The study will test and refine the two experimental implementation strategy interventions, health coaching (patient-facing) and practice coaching (clinician-facing). This study will also pilot economic data collection tools and collect qualitative data for a formative evaluation. The analytic goals are to inform the statistical design and data collection processes for the subsequent cluster-randomized DIGITS Trial.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Non-randomized parallel groups pilot study to evaluate intervention delivery, data collection, and analysis procedures. Two primary care clinics will implement the reSET and reSET-O digital therapeutics for substance use disorders. There will be one clinic per arm in this pilot study. Implementation strategies will be varied across arms.

primary_outcome.measure: Reach of the digital therapeutic to patients in the primary care clinic
primary_outcome.description: The proportion of patients who initiate the digital therapeutic, defined by instances in which patients open the app, enter the prescription code, and use a treatment module

primary_outcome.measure: Fidelity of patients use of the digital therapeutic to clinical recommendations
primary_outcome.description: Mean number of weeks in which patients use 4 app modules/week and have visited a clinician in the past month

secondary_outcome.description: Mean number of months in which patients make monthly visits for substance use disorder

other_outcome.description: The proportion of patients prescribed reSET or reSET-O
The proportion of patients who download and unlock reSET or reSET-O
Mean number of weeks in which patients use at least 1 module/week
Mean number of weeks in which patients use at least 4 modules/week
The proportion of other healthcare providers initiating a patient on reSET or reSET-O, overall and by provider type

arm_group.description: The clinic in this arm will implement reSET and reSET-O with a standard implementation strategy and patients at the clinic will receive support from a health coach to help them engage with reSET and reSET-O.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard Implementation Plus Health Coaching and Practice Facilitation
arm_group.description: The clinic in this arm will implement reSET and reSET-O with a standard implementation strategy and patients at the clinic will receive support from a health coach to help them engage with reSET and reSET-O. Additionally, a practice facilitator will provide the clinic with support for implementation.

intervention.description: The clinic is provided access to a health coach who conducts outreach with patients. The health coach facilitates engagement with the digital therapeutic and encourages contact with the care team.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard Implementation Plus Health Coaching and Practice Facilitation

intervention.description: In the context of a supportive relationship, a trained facilitator delivers the following interventions to clinic staff: Bolster Education, Audit and Provide Feedback, Support Plan-Do-Study-Act Cycles, Engage Others in Change.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard Implementation Plus Health Coaching and Practice Facilitation

intervention.description: Brief clinician training and an implementation toolkit consisting of job aids, patient educational materials, scripted conversations, electronic health record tools, and a population management workbench.
intervention.arm_group_label: Standard Implementation Plus Health Coaching and Practice Facilitation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Had a primary care visit in a participating clinic during the pilot
- Screened positive for substance use
- Adult aged 18 years or older at time of visit
Exclusion Criteria:
- None
